verses.text: Then on that day David first appointed to give thanks to Yahweh by the hand of Asaph and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to Yahweh; call upon his name;
    make known his deeds among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him; sing praises to him;
    tell of his wondrous works!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those seeking Yahweh rejoice!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek Yahweh and his strength;
    seek his face continually!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember his wonderful works that he has done,
    his wonders and the judgments of his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O offspring of Israel, his servant,
    O sons of Jacob, his chosen ones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is Yahweh our God;
    his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember his covenant forever,
    the word he commanded for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that he made with Abraham,
    his sworn oath to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
    an everlasting covenant to Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
    the portion of your inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you were few in number, little,
    and sojourners were in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when they wandered from nation to nation,
    and from one kingdom to another people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he did not allow anyone to oppress them,
    and he rebuked kings on their account,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “You must not touch my anointed
    nor do harm to my prophets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Yahweh, all the earth!
    Proclaim his salvation from day to day!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Proclaim his glory among the nations,
    his wondrous works among the peoples!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh is great and greatly praised,
    and he is feared among all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the nations are idols,
    but Yahweh made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Splendor and majesty are before him;
    strength and joy are in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to Yahweh, O clans of the nations,
    ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory of his name!
    Lift up an offering and come before him!
    Bow down to Yahweh in the splendor of holiness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble before him, all the earth;
    surely the world shall not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad,
    and let them tell the peoples, “Yahweh reigns!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea roar and its fullness;
    let the field rejoice and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the trees of the forest shall sing for joy before Yahweh,
    for he comes to judge the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good;
    his loyal love is everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then say, “Save us, O God of our salvation;
    gather us and rescue us from the nations
    that we may give thanks to your holy name
    and glory in your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Yahweh the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting!”
Then all the people said, “Amen!” and praised Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh to minister before the ark regularly as each day required,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he left Obed-Edom with his sixty-eight brothers. And Obed-Edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left Zadok the priest and his brothers the priests before the tabernacle of Yahweh at the high place which was at Gibeon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to offer burnt offerings regularly to Yahweh on the altar of burnt offering, morning and evening, according to all that was written in the law of Yahweh that he commanded concerning Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with them were Heman and Jeduthun and the remainder of those chosen, who were designated by name to give thanks to Yahweh, for his loyal love is everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Heman and Jeduthun with them had trumpets and cymbals for making music, along with instruments for the song of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people went each to his house, and David turned to bless his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as David lived in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Look, I live in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is under tent curtains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nathan said to David, “Whatever is in your heart, do, for God is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that same night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and say to David my servant, ‘Thus says Yahweh, “You are not to build a house for me to live in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not lived in a house from the day that I brought out Israel unto this day. I have been from tent to tent and from tabernacle to tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In every place I have moved about, did I say one word with the judges of Israel I commanded to shepherd my people, saying, ‘Why have you not built for me a house of cedar?’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, thus you shall say to my servant David, ‘Thus says Yahweh of hosts, “I took you from the pasture, from following the sheep, to be leader over my people Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have been with you wherever you went and have cut down your enemies from before you and will make a name for you, like the name of the great ones on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and I will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place and be in anguish no longer. And wicked men will no longer wear them down as before,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the day that I commanded judges over my people Israel. And I will subdue your enemies, and I declare to you that Yahweh will build for you a house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be that when your days are fulfilled to go and sleep with your ancestors, then I will raise up your seed after you, who will be one of your sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself will build for me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will be a father to him, and he himself will be a son to me. And I will not remove my steadfast love from him as I took it away from whoever was before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will establish him in my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all these words and according to all this revelation, thus did Nathan speak to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David went and sat before Yahweh and said, “Who am I, O Yahweh God, and what is my house that you have brought me thus far?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was a small matter in your eyes, O God. And you have spoken concerning the house of your servant for a long time and have shown me future generations to come, O Yahweh God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What more can David do to you for honoring your servant? Now you know your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Yahweh, for the sake of your servant and according to your heart you have done all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Yahweh, there is none like you, and there is no God except you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who is like your people Israel, the one nation upon earth whom God went to redeem for himself, to establish for you a reputation for great and awesome things, to drive out nations from before your people whom you redeemed from Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you made your people Israel an everlasting nation for yourself. And you, O Yahweh, became their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, O Yahweh, let the word that you spoke to your servant and to his house be established forever, that you might do what you have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let your name be established and be magnified forever, saying, ‘Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel, is Israel’s God, and may the house of David your servant be established before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, my God, have informed your servant that you will build a house for him. Therefore, your servant has found courage to pray before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, O Yahweh, you yourself are God, and you have spoken to your servant this good thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now may you begin to bless the house of your servant to continue forever before you, for you, O Yahweh, have blessed. And it will be blessed forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after David struck the Philistines and subdued them, he captured Gath and its villages out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he struck Moab, and the Moabites became servants to David, bearing tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David struck Hadadezer, king of Zobah-Hamath, as he set up his monument at the Euphrates River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David captured from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. And David hamstrung all the chariot horses but left one hundred of them to remain for chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah-Hamath, David struck down twenty-two thousand men of Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David set up garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became servants to David, bearing tribute. And Yahweh delivered David wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took small round shields of gold that were upon the servants of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David captured very much bronze. Solomon made the bronze sea with it along with the columns and objects of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Tou the king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the whole army of Hadadezer the king of Zobah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he sent Hadoram his son to King David to ask him for peace and to bless him because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him, for Tou had been at war with Hadadezer. And he brought with him all the objects of gold, silver, and bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David dedicated these also to Yahweh, along with the silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations, from Edom, Moab, the sons of Ammon, the Philistines, and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abishai son of Zeruiah defeated eighteen thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put garrisons in Edom, and all Edom became servants to David. And Yahweh delivered David wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David reigned over all Israel, and he administered justice and righteousness to all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army, and Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests, and Shavsha was secretary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and the Pelethites. And the sons of David were chief officials under the hand of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after this Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, “I will deal kindly with Hanun the son of Nahash because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And the servants of David came to the land of the Ammonites, to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the princes of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Do you think because David sent comforters to you that David honors your father? Is it not for the purpose of exploring so as to overthrow and spy out the land that his servants have come to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hanun took the servants of David and shaved them and cut off their garments at the middle, up to the buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and told David concerning the men, and he inquired of them, for the men were very disgraced. And the king said, “Dwell in Jericho until your beards grow out; then return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Ammonites saw that they made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent one thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves horses and chariots from Aram-Naharaim, Aram-Maacah, and Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots and the king of Maacah and his people, and they came and encamped before Medeba. And the Ammonites were gathered from their cities and came to the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David heard, he sent Joab and the entire army of mighty warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Ammonites went out and took up positions for battle at the entrance of the city. And the kings who had come were alone in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joab saw that there was a battle line against him at the front and the back, he chose from among the chosen men in Israel and arranged them to meet Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the remainder of the people he put in the hand of Abishai his brother, and they were arranged to meet the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “If Aram is too strong for me, then you must be a help to me, but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong! Let us strengthen ourselves on behalf of our people and on behalf of the cities of our God. And may Yahweh do what is good in his eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab and the people who were with him drew near before Aram for battle, and they fled before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Ammonites saw that Aram had fled, they also fled before Abishai his brother, and they came to the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aram saw that they were defeated before Israel, they sent messengers and brought out Aram, who was from beyond the Euphrates, with Shophach the commander of the army of Hadadezer before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was told to David, he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan. And he came to them and was arrayed against them. Then David was arrayed to meet Aram in battle, and they fought with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aram fled before Israel. And David killed from Aram the men of seven thousand chariots and forty thousand foot soldiers, and he put to death Shophach the commander of the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated before Israel, they made peace with David and became servants to him. So Aram was no longer willing to help the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that in the spring time of year, the time when kings go out to battle, Joab led the troops of the army and destroyed the land of the Ammonites. And he came and besieged Rabbah, but David remained in Jerusalem. And Joab struck Rabbah and destroyed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took the crown of their king from his head and found it to weigh a talent of gold. And in it was a precious stone. Then it was placed upon the head of David. And he brought out the booty of the city, a large amount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people who were in it he brought out, and he set them to work with saws and iron implements and axes. Thus David did to all the cities of the Ammonites. Then David returned, and all the nation went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this there arose a war in Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite struck down Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaim. And they were subdued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again there was war with the Philistines. And Elhanan son of Jair struck down Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again there was war in Gath. And there was a very tall man there, and he had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in all. He himself was also a descendant of the Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taunted Israel, but Jehonathan son of Shimea, brother of David, struck him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were born to the giants in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan stood against Israel and urged David to count Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David said to Joab and to the commanders of the nation, “Go, count Israel from Beersheba to Dan and bring a report to me that I might know their number.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joab said, “May Yahweh add to the people a hundred times what they are! Are they not, O my lord the king, all of them the king’s servants? Why does my lord seek this? Why would he bring guilt to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of the king prevailed over Joab. Then he went about through all Israel and came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab gave the number of the enrollment of the people to David. And it happened that all Israel was one million one hundred thousand men drawing a sword, and in Judah were four hundred and seventy thousand men drawing a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not count Levi and Benjamin among them, for the word of the king was repulsive to Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this word was displeasing in the eyes of God, and he struck Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to God, “I have sinned severely in that I have done this thing. But now, please forgive the sin of your servant, for I have been very foolish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Gad the seer of David, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, you must speak to David, saying, ‘Thus says Yahweh: “Three choices I offer to you. Choose one of them for yourself that I will do to you.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says Yahweh: ‘Choose for yourself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whether three years of famine or three months of devastation by your enemies while the sword of your enemies overtakes you, or three days of the sword of Yahweh, with disease in the land and the angel of Yahweh destroying throughout all the territory in Israel.’ So now, see what word I should return to my sender.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Gad, “I am very troubled. Let me into the hand of Yahweh, for his compassion is very great, but do not let me fall into the hand of a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh sent a pestilence through Israel, and seventy thousand men from Israel fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, and as he was about to destroy it, Yahweh saw and was grieved on account of the calamity. Then he said to the angel, the destroyer, “It is enough; slacken your hand.” And the angel of Yahweh was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David lifted his eyes and saw the angel of Yahweh standing between earth and heaven, with his sword drawn in his hand, stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to God, “Was it not I who gave a command to count the people? Now I am he who has sinned, and I have certainly done wickedness, but these sheep, what have they done? O Yahweh, my God, please let your hand be against me and against the house of my father, but against your people, let there be no plague.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the angel of Yahweh had spoken to Gad to say to David that David should go up and erect an altar for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went up at the word of Gad that he had spoken in the name of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ornan was threshing wheat, and Ornan turned and saw the angel, and his four sons with him hid themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David came to Ornan, and Ornan looked and saw David. And he went out from the threshing floor, and they bowed down to David, faces to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Ornan, “Please give me the place, the threshing floor, that I might build an altar on it to Yahweh; at full price please give it to me, that the plague against the people might be stopped.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ornan said to David, “Take it to yourself; let my lord the king do what is good in his eyes. See, I give the cattle for the burnt offerings and threshing sledges for the wood and wheat for the grain offering—I give it all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King David said to Ornan, “No, for I will certainly buy it at full value; indeed, I will not take what is yours for Yahweh and offer burnt offerings for nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave to Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David built an altar there to Yahweh, and he offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and he called to Yahweh. And he answered him with fire from heaven upon the altar of burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh commanded the angel, and he returned his sword to its sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, when David saw that Yahweh answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he sacrificed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the tabernacle of Yahweh that Moses had made in the desert and the altar of burnt offering were at that time at the high place of Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David was not able to go before it to seek God, for he was afraid on account of the sword of the angel of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “This will be the house of Yahweh God, and this altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David commanded to assemble the resident aliens who were in the land of Israel and appointed stone craftsmen to cut dressed stones to build the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David provided much iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for the seams, and abundant copper that could not be weighed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cedar timbers without number, for the Sidonians and Tyrians brought abundant cedars to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “Solomon my son is a boy and inexperienced, and the house built for Yahweh must be exceedingly great in fame and splendor throughout every land. I will make preparations for him.” So David provided abundant materials before he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called to Solomon his son and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Solomon his son, “I myself had in my heart to build a house for the name of Yahweh my God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it happened that the word of Yahweh came over me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and have made much war; you shall not build a house for my name because you have shed much blood upon the ground before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a son shall be born to you; he himself will be a man of rest, and I will give rest to him from all his enemies all around, for his name will be Solomon, and peace and quietness I will give to Israel in his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself will build a house for my name, and he himself will be to me a son, and I will be to him as a father, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, my son, Yahweh will be with you, that you may succeed and build the house of Yahweh your God as he has spoken concerning you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only may Yahweh give to you understanding and insight that he might give you charge over Israel and the keeping of the law of Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will prosper if you take care to do the statutes and judgments which Yahweh commanded Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and be courageous; fear not and do not be dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now see, with great effort I have made provision for the house of Yahweh: 100,000 talents of gold, 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron that cannot be weighed, for there is an abundance. Also timber and stone I have provided, but to these you should add.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with you there is an abundance of craftsmen: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and everyone skilled in every kind of craftsmanship
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with gold, silver, bronze, and iron without number. Arise and work! Yahweh will be with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David commanded all the commanders of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not Yahweh your God with you? And has he not given you rest all around? For he has put in my hand the inhabitants of the land, and the land is subdued before Yahweh and before his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now set your heart and mind to seek Yahweh your Go, and arise and build the sanctuary of Yahweh God, that the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and the holy vessels of God might be brought into the house built for the name of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was old and full of days. And he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he assembled all the commanders of Israel and the priests and the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites thirty years old and above were counted, and their number according to their head count for the men was thirty-eight thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these, David said, “Twenty-four thousand are to direct the work of the house of Yahweh, along with six thousand judges and officials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: four thousand gatekeepers, and four thousand offering praise with the instruments that I have made for praise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David organized them in divisions according to the sons of Levi: to Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Gershonites were Ladan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief and Zetham and Joel, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the families of Ladan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah; these four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons. They were enrolled as one for the house of a father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart to consecrate the most holy things. He and his sons were to burn offerings forever before Yahweh to serve him and to bless in his name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses the man of God and his sons were reckoned among the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah, the head. And Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief and Isshiah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar died, and he did not have sons, but only daughters. And the sons of Kish, their relatives, married them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Levi according to the house of their fathers, the heads of the families, according to their enrollment, by the number of the names, according to their head count, who were to do the work of the service of the house of Yahweh, from twenty years old and above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David said, “Yahweh, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people, and he dwells in Jerusalem forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also, the Levites do not need to carry the tabernacle and all its vessels for its service.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by the last words of David, they are the number of the sons of Levi, from twenty years old and above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their station was to assist the sons of Aaron with the service of the house of Yahweh, over the courtyards, over the chambers, and over the cleansing of all the sanctified objects, and with the work of the service of the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with the rows of bread, the flour, the grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baked offering, the offering mixed with oil, and for all the amounts and measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were to stand every morning, thanking and praising Yahweh, and likewise in the evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for every burnt offering offered to Yahweh, on Sabbaths, on new moon festivals, and at the appointed feasts, according to the customary number required of them, regularly before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall keep the responsibility of the tent of assembly, the responsibility of the sanctified objects, and the responsibility of the sons of Aaron, their brothers, to serve the house of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the sons of Aaron, these were their divisions. The sons of Aaron were Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and they had no sons, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their appointments for their service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And more sons of Eleazar were found as heads of the men than the sons of Ithamar, so they divided them to the sons of Eleazar to be sixteen heads over the house of the fathers, and to the sons of Ithamar over the house of the fathers were eight heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They divided them by lot all alike, for they were commanders of the sanctuary and commanders of God from among the sons of Eleazar and the sons of Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shemaiah the son of Nethanel, the scribe, from the Levites, recorded them before the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the families of the priests and Levites, one father’s house drawn by Lot for Eleazar and one drawn by lot for Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first lot went out to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth to Malkijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shekaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Ha-Pizzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Ezekiel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-first to Jakin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their appointments for their service to come into the house of Yahweh according to their custom by the hand of Aaron their father, as Yahweh the God of Israel had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the remainder of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons Shelomoth, Jahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Jeriah, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel, Micah; the sons of Micah, Shamur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The brother of Micah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah, his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari: of Jaaziah, his son, Shoham, Zakkur, and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Kish: the sons of Kish, Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites according to the house of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lots were also cast for these, just as their brothers, the sons of Aaron, before David the king, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the families for the priests and for the Levites the fathers, on the principle of the chief and younger brother alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied with stringed instruments, with harps, and with cymbals. And their inventory of the men of the work and for their duty was:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the sons of Asaph: Zakkur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah, sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied under the hands of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Heshabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the stringed instrument with thanksgiving and praise to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were sons to Heman, the seer of the king, according to the words of God to raise a horn. And God had given to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were under the direction of their father in the music of the house of Yahweh, with cymbals, harps, and stringed instruments for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the direction of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their number, along with their brothers, trained singers, all the skilled people for Yahweh, were two hundred and eighty-eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots for responsibilities on the principle of small and great alike, teacher with student.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first lot for Asaph went out to Joseph; the second to Gedaliahu; he and his brothers and his twelve sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third, Zakkur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth, Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixth, Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh, Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighth, Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth, Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tenth, Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eleventh, Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the fifteenth, to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the sixteenth, to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the seventeenth, to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the eighteenth, to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the nineteenth, to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the twentieth, to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the twenty-first, to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the twenty-second, to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the twenty-third, to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the twenty-fourth, to Romamti-ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the working groups of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, from the sons of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam the fifth, Jehohana the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Obed-Edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sachar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Shemaiah his son were sons born who were rulers in the house of their father, for they were mighty warriors of ability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers were sons of ability, Elihu and Semakiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these from the sons of Obed-Edom, they and their sons, and their brothers were men of ability with strength for service; sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, sons of ability, eighteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hosah, from the sons of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (though he was not firstborn, his father appointed him as chief),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tabaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brothers of Hosah were thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These working groups of gatekeepers, corresponding to the chief men, had responsibilities like their brothers to serve in the house of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots, small and great alike, by their fathers’ houses, for their gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lot fell to the east to Shelemiah. As for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots. And his lot came out for the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Obed-Edom went out the south, and to his sons, the storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Shuppim and Hosah it went out for the west, at the gate of Shalleketh, on the road that goes up, guard for guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the east, six Levites; to the north, four daily; to the south, four daily; and at the storerooms, two by two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the court to the west, four at the road, two at the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the working groups of the gatekeepers among the sons of the Korahites and among the sons of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the Levites: Ahijah was over the treasuries of the house of God and over the treasuries of the sanctified objects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan: the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the families belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham and Joel his brother, were over the treasuries of the house of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Ozzielites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was commander over the treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brothers: from Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zikri his son, and Shelomoth his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasuries of the sanctified objects that King David and the heads of the families to the commanders of thousands and hundreds and the commanders of the army had dedicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the battles and from the spoil they had dedicated these things to strengthen the house of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated—all the dedicated gifts were under the hand of Shelomith and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Izharites: Kenaniah and his sons were appointed to the duties outside of Israel as officials and as judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred men of ability, were over the administration of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the work of Yahweh and for the service of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Hebronites: Jeriah the chief of the Hebronites for the genealogy for the families. (In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were examined, and there was found among them mighty warriors of strength at Jazer in Gilead.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brothers, sons of ability, were two thousand seven hundred heads of the families, and King David appointed them over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for every matter of God and matter of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the number of the Israelites, the heads of families, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officials who serve the king in all matters of the working groups that came and went, month by month, throughout all the months of the year, each working group: twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the first working group for the first month: Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Perez who was the chief of the commanders of the armies for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the working groups of the second month: Dodai the Ahohite and his working group, and Mikloth the commander. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third commander of the army for the third month was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the chief priest. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was Benaiah who was a mighty warrior of thirty, and over the thirty and his working group was Ammizabad his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth, for the fourth month, was Asahel the brother of Joab and his son Zebadiah after him. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth, for the fifth month, the commander was Shamhuth the Izrahite. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez the Pelonite, from the sons of Ephraim. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbecai the Hushathite of the Zerahites. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathothite of the Benjamites. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Netophathite of the Zerahites. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah the Pirathonite from the sons of Ephraim. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel. And he was over his working group of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the tribes of Israel, for the Reubenites: the commander was Eliezer the son of Zikri. For the Simeonites: Shephatiah the son of Maacah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Levi: Hashabiah the son of Kemuel. For Aaron, Zadok.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Judah: Elihu, from the brothers of David. For Issachar: Omri the son of Michael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Zebulun: Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah. For Naphtali: Jerimoth the son of Azriel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Ephraimites: Hoshea the son of Azaziah. For the half-tribe of Manasseh: Joel the son of Pedaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead: Iddo the son of Zechariah. For Benjamin: Jaasiel son of Abner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Dan: Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the commanders of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David did not take a census of those twenty years old or under because Yahweh promised to make Israel more numerous than the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to count, but he did not finish. But wrath came upon Israel concerning this, and the number was not included in the chronicles of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the treasury rooms of the king was Azmaveth the son of Adiel. And over the treasuries in the country, in the cities, in the unwalled villages, and in the towers was Jonathan the son of Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over those who did the work in the field to till the soil was Ezri the son of Kelub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the vineyards was Shemei the Ramathite. And over the produce in the vineyards for the storehouses of the wine was Zabdi the Shiphmite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the Shephelah was Baal-Hanan the Gederite. And over the treasury houses of olive oil was Joash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the cattle pastured in the Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite. And over the cattle in the valley was Shaphat the son of Adlai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite. And over the female donkeys was Jehdeiah the Meronothite. And over the sheep was Jaziz the Hagrite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these were officials of the property of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehonathan the uncle of David was an adviser, a man of insight, and he was a scribe. And Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the sons of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ahithophel was an adviser to the king, and Hushai the Arkite was a friend of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Ahithophel came Jehoiada, the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. And Joab was the commander of the king’s army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David assembled all the commanders of Israel, the commanders of the tribes and the commanders of working groups who served the king, and the commanders of thousands, the commanders of hundreds, and the commanders over all the property of the king and his sons, with the court officials and mighty warriors, and all the mighty warriors of ability, at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King David rose to his feet and said, “Listen to me, my brothers and my people. I myself wanted to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and the footstool of our God, and I prepared to build.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to me, ‘You may not build a house for my name because you are a man of war, and you have shed blood.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh the God of Israel chose me from all of the house of my father to be king over Israel forever, for he chose Judah as leader, and in the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to reign over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from all my sons—for Yahweh has given many sons to me—he has chosen Solomon my son to sit on the throne of the kingdom of Yahweh over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, ‘Solomon your son, he himself shall build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him as a son to myself, and I myself will be as a father to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will establish his kingdom forever if he firmly performs my commandments and my judgments as he has to this day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of Yahweh, and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek all the commandments of Yahweh your God so that you may take possession of this good land and bestow it as an inheritance to your children after you forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve him with a whole heart and a willing mind, for Yahweh searches all hearts and understands every plan and all thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you abandon him, he will reject you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look now, for Yahweh has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong and do it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the plan of the vestibule and of its houses, its treasuries, its upper rooms, its inner chambers, and of the house of the lid of the ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the plan of all that he had in mind for the courtyards of the house of Yahweh and for all the surrounding storage rooms, the treasuries of the house of God, and the treasuries for sanctified objects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the working groups of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of Yahweh, and for all the vessels for the service of the house of Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the gold, according to the weight of the gold for all the vessels of the service, and the service of all the vessels of silver according to the weight of all the vessels for every kind of service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the weight of the golden lampstands and the golden lamps, the weight of each lampstand and each lamp, and the silver according to the weight of a lampstand and its lamp, according to the use of each lampstand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the weight of gold for the tables of the arranged bread, each table, and silver for the tables of silver,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and pure gold for the three-pronged meat forks, and the bowls and the pitchers, and for the golden bowls, by weight for each bowl, and for the silver bowls, by weight for each bowl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the altar of incense made of refined gold, by weight, and gold for the plan for the chariot—the cherubim with outspread and covering wings over the ark of the covenant of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All this I give you in writing; from the hand of Yahweh he instructed me about all the workings of this plan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and courageous, and do this! Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed, for Yahweh God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you and will not forsake you until all the work of the service of the house of Yahweh is finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the working groups of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God; and with you in all the work for all those willing with the skill for every service, and the commanders and all the people for all your commands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David the king said to all the assembly, “God has chosen Solomon my son alone, a young man and inexperienced, and the work is great, for the citadel is not for humankind, but for Yahweh God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I have provided for the house of my God according to all my strength, the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, the bronze for the things of bronze, the iron for the things of iron, and the wood for the things of wood, along with an abundance of onyx stones, stones for settings, stones of turquoise, and variegated stones, and all kinds of precious stones and alabaster stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And moreover, with respect to my provisions for the house of my God I have a treasure of gold and silver that I have given to the house of my God above all that I have provided for the holy house:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three thousand talents of gold from the gold of Ophir and seven thousand talents of refined silver to overlay the walls of the houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: gold for the golden things and silver for the silver things, for all the work by the hand of skilled craftsmen. Now who will offer willingly, consecrating himself today to Yahweh?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the commanders of the families, the commanders of the tribes of Israel, and the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the commanders of the work of the king offered themselves willingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave for the service of the house of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of Yahweh under the authority of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people rejoiced over their freewill offering, for with a whole heart they had willingly offered to Yahweh, and King David also rejoiced with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David blessed Yahweh in the sight of all the assembly, and David said, “Blessed are you, O Yahweh, God of Israel, our father forever and ever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you, O Yahweh, is the greatness and the power and the splendor and the glory and the strength, for everything in the heavens and in the earth. Yours, O Yahweh, is the kingdom and exaltation over all as head!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wealth and glory are from you, and you rule over all. And in your hand is power and might. And in your hand is power to make great and to give strength to all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, our God, we give thanks to you and offer praise to the name of your splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And indeed, who am I, and who are my people that we retain power to offer according to these offerings willingly? For everything is from you, and from your hand we have given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are strangers before you and sojourners like all our ancestors. Our days are like the shadow upon earth, and there is no hope of abiding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Yahweh our God, all this abundance that we have provided to build for you a house for your holy name is from your hand, and all of it is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know, my God, that you yourself test the heart and are pleased with uprightness. I, in the uprightness of my heart, have willingly offered all these things, and now I have seen your people who are found here willingly offer to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Yahweh, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our ancestors, keep this forever as a plan and thoughts of the heart of your people, and establish their heart toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grant to Solomon my son a heart of peace to keep your commands, your statutes, and your regulations to do everything, and to build the citadel for which I have provided.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to all the assembly, “Bless Yahweh your God!” And all the assembly blessed Yahweh, the God of their ancestors. And they bowed down and prostrated themselves before Yahweh and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they offered sacrifices to Yahweh, and on that next day they offered burnt offerings to Yahweh: one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, one thousand lambs, with their libations and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they ate and drank before Yahweh on that day with great joy. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and they anointed him commander for Yahweh, and Zadok the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon sat upon the throne of Yahweh as king in place of David his father. And he prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the officials and mighty warriors, and also all the sons of King David, pledged allegiance to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh made Solomon exceedingly great in the sight of all Israel, and he bestowed upon him royal splendor that was not bestowed upon any king before him in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the days that he reigned over Israel were forty years. In Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he died in a good old age, full of days, wealth, and honor. And Solomon his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the words of King David, from the first to the last, see, they are written among the words of Samuel the seer, and among the words of Nathan the prophet, and among the words of Gad the seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all the accounts of his kingdom, his power, and the times that came upon him, and upon Israel, and upon all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
